plugin.description: Making it easier to work with Project notes in NotePlan. Start, regularly review, pause, complete and cancel projects. Inspired by the PARA and 'Getting Things Done' methods, but more widely applicable.
plugin.author: Jonathan Clark

1.3.0.b9: New 'Also write most recent Progress line to frontmatter?' option.

plugin.settings.title: What do you want to Review?
Hashtags to review
plugin.settings.description:
A comma-separated list of hashtags to indicate notes to include in this review system.
If this setting is empty, then it will include all notes for review that include a '@review(...)' string.
If it is set (e.g. '#project, #area'), then it will include just those notes which also have one or more of those tags.

plugin.settings.title: Use Perspectives to filter projects?
plugin.settings.description:
Whether to use the current Perspective definition from the Dashboard plugin to filter the projects to review, by (Team)Space(s) and/or folder(s).
Note: this requires the Dashboard plugin to be installed, and if set it overrides the following 2 settings.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to Include
plugin.settings.description:
Specify which folders to include (which includes any of their sub-folders) as a comma-separated list. This match is done anywhere in the folder name, so you could simply say 'Project' which would match for 'Client A/Projects' as well as 'Client B/Projects'.
Notes:
- if you specify the root folder '/' this only includes the root folder itself, and not all its sub-folders.
- if empty, all folders will be used apart from those in the next setting.
- if 'Use Perspectives' is set, then this setting is ignored.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to Exclude
plugin.settings.description:
If 'Folders to Include' above is empty, then this setting specifies folders to ignore (which includes any of their sub-folders too) as a comma-separated list. This match is done anywhere in the folder name. Can be empty.
Notes:
- if you specify the root folder '/' this only ignores the root folder, and not all sub-folders.
- the special @Trash, @Templates and @Archive folders are always excluded.
- if 'Use Perspectives' is set, then this setting is ignored.

plugin.settings.title: Ignore tasks set more than these days in the future
plugin.settings.description: If set more than 0, then when the progress percentage is calculated it will ignore items scheduled more than this number of days in the future. (Default is 0 days -- i.e. no future items are ignored).

plugin.settings.title: Ignore checklists in progress?
plugin.settings.description: If set, then checklists in progress will not be counted as part of the project's completion percentage.

plugin.settings.title: Output style to use
plugin.settings.description:
Use 'Rich' (HTML) output, or use NotePlan's original 'Markdown' output style.
Note: the 'Rich' output can't result in a saved note, so that's why there's also an option to do both.

plugin.settings.title: Open 'Rich' Project List in what sort of macOS window?
plugin.settings.description: On NotePlan v3.20+ on macOS only, you can open the 'Rich' output window in different ways: 'New Window' for a separate window; 'Main Window' to take over the main window; 'Split View' for a split view in the main window.

plugin.settings.title: Folder to store markdown-style review notes
plugin.settings.description: Folder where review notes will be stored (will be created if necessary). Note: this only applies to the markdown-style review notes, not the HTML-style ones.

plugin.settings.title: Project Display order
plugin.settings.description: The ordering options are by 'due' date, by next 'review' date or 'title'.

plugin.settings.title: Show projects grouped by folder?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to group the projects by their folder.

plugin.settings.title: Hide higher-level folder names in headings?
plugin.settings.description: If 'Show projects grouped by folder?' (above) is set, this hides all but the lowest-level subfolder name in headings.

plugin.settings.title: Show completed/cancelled projects?
plugin.settings.description: If set, then completed/cancelled projects will be shown at the end of the list of active projects.

plugin.settings.title: Only show projects/areas ready for review?
plugin.settings.description: If not ticked then it will show all project/area notes, not just ones ready for review. (Paused ones are always shown.)

plugin.settings.title: Show project dates?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the project's review and due dates (where set).

plugin.settings.title: Show project's latest progress?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the project's latest progress summary text. These are only shown where there are specific 'Progress:' field(s) in the note.

plugin.settings.title: Display next actions in output?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to display the next action in the output? Note: these are defined as the first item with the following 'next action tags' (below), or the first open task/checklist if the 'Sequential tag' (below) is set.

plugin.settings.title: Window width
plugin.settings.description: Width of the Review List window (pixels)

plugin.settings.title: Window height
plugin.settings.description: Height of the Review List window (pixels)

plugin.settings.title: Next action tag(s)
plugin.settings.description: Optional comma-separated list of possible #hashtags to include in a task or checklist to indicate its the next action in this project. (Default: '#na'). Note: if the 'Sequential project marker' (below) is set on a project note, then this setting is ignored.

plugin.settings.title: Sequential project marker
plugin.settings.description: The marker to identify sequential projects. If this appears in a project's frontmatter 'project' attribute, or the metadata line, the first open task/checklist will be shown as a next action.

plugin.settings.title: Progress Heading
plugin.settings.description: Optional heading name to organize Progress lines under. If set, all Progress lines will be added under this heading. If the heading doesn't exist, it will be created automatically.

plugin.settings.title: Progress Heading level
plugin.settings.description: The heading level (1-5) to use for the Progress heading. Level 1 is the highest, level 5 is the lowest.

plugin.settings.title: Also write most recent Progress line to frontmatter?
plugin.settings.description: If set, each time a Progress line is added the latest line will also be written into the note's frontmatter as a 'progress' field.

plugin.settings.title: Confirm next Review?
plugin.settings.description: When running '/next project review' it asks whether to start the next review.

plugin.settings.title: Finished List Heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading of list of completed or cancelled projects/areas in the yearly note

plugin.settings.title: Folder to Archive completed/cancelled project notes to
plugin.settings.description: By default this is the built-in Archive folder (shown in the sidebar) which has the special name '@Archive', but it can be set to any other folder name.

plugin.settings.title: Archive using folder structure?
plugin.settings.description:
When you complete or cancel a project, and you opt to move it to the Archive, if set this will replicating the project note's existing folder structure inside your chosen Archive folder (set above).
(This is the same thing that the Filer plugin's "/archive note using folder structure" command does, though Filer does not need to be installed to use this.)

plugin.settings.title: Remove due dates when pausing a project?
plugin.settings.description: If set this will remove all >dates from open tasks/checklists in this project.

plugin.settings.title: Project start string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was started (default: '@start')

plugin.settings.title: Project completed string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was completed (default: '@completed')

plugin.settings.title: Project cancelled string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was cancelled (default: '@cancelled')

plugin.settings.title: Project due string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area is due to be finished (default: '@due')

plugin.settings.title: Project review interval string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating review interval for project/area (default: '@review')

plugin.settings.title: Project reviewed string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was last reviewed (default: '@reviewed')

plugin.settings.title: Project next review string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date you next want a project/area to be reviewed (default: '@nextReview')

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing Tidy commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs

plugin.settings.title: Regex for Functions to show in debug log
plugin.settings.description: Overrides the Log Level above if this regex matches the first argument in log*() calls. If not set, has no effect.

plugin.settings.title: Enable Timer logging?
plugin.settings.description: For plugin authors to help optimise the plugin.
